page.title: 17Development of Beckenham
page.content: This area originally consisted of a number of manors, their adjoining farmland, and woodlands. Although most of these old manors have now disappeared, their names are perpetuated in local street names,eg Foxgrove Road. There was a village near the church of St. George's, Beckenham. The building of the railway led to a great increase in house and road building and to the major development of the area. Early this century further development took place. For example, there were grandiose plans for building a new shopping centre, complete with bandstand and with roads in concentric circles round it, in the southern part of this block. The First World War put an end to most of this scheme, and only the residential area of Park Langley remains of it.
